full_text:
In the Court of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram
Present: Elsa Catherine George
Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate.
Dated the 1* day of March 2025
CC: 42/2024
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police,
Pettah Police Station in Crime No. 1132/2023
(By A.P.P )
Accused : Salahudheen, 64 years, S/o Badharkhan, Savith
Manzil, Charuvila Puthen Veedu, Near St.Vincent
School, Keralapuram, Idavattom, 8" Ward, Perunad
Village, Kollam.
Offence : u/s 279, 337 and 338 of IPC
Plea : Guilty
Finding : Guilty
Sentence/order : Accused is sentenced to pay a fine of %.2500/- for the
offences punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 IPC in
default of payment of fine the accused shall undergo
simple imprisonment for 25 days.
This case having been heard today, the court passed the following:-
JUDGMENT
1. Accused stands charged with the offences punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 of
IPC.
2. Accused entered appearance through counsel. Requirements u/s.207 Cr.PC was
complied with. The particulars of offences were read over and explained to his

counsel to which he pleaded guilty. I accept the plea since I am convinced of its
genuineness and that the same is made voluntarily. Hence, I find the accused
guilty of the offences punishable u/s. 279, 337 and 338 of IPC and accordingly he
is convicted and sentenced to pay a fine of %.2500/- for the offences punishable
u/s. 279, 337 and 338 IPC in default of payment of fine, the accused shall undergo
simple imprisonment for 25 days.
Dated this the 1* day of March 2025.
â‚¬
. Sor"
Zi RUS .
Gal aaa s/s] Elsa Catherine George,
, CS teanssXs , Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate,
. 8 Thiruvananthapuram.
